title: Mathematics Education Design Utilizing Mobile Computing Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic math concepts and experience using mobile devices
context.additional_context: Conducted in a blended environment combining in-person instruction and online activities, students perform projects using mobile app prototyping tools in teams.

learning_goals: Design the mathematical problem-solving process as mobile computational thinking (CT) following the 5E instructional model.

Within three weeks, learners develop a mobile app prototype using Thunkable or MIT App Inventor that calculates the area of three or more geometric shapes (triangle, quadrilateral, circle) in real time, submitting results meeting: 1) Support for three shapes, 2) Real-time calculation based on user input, 3) Error rate within ±5% for five test cases, 4) Functionality demonstration video under three minutes

In teams of 3–4, learners develop a computational game app prototype applying CT concepts (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction) within four weeks, achieving over 80 points on peer and instructor evaluation criteria (Functionality 30%, Creativity 20%, CT Application 50%)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
